hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Regime Transition Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL-to-BULL regime transitions (as signaled by FjordHQ's regime model), when 20-day realized volatility drops below 40% while spot CVD (Cumulative Volume Delta) shows sustained accumulation (>5 days of positive delta), implied volatility will be underpriced, and long volatility positions will generate 15-25% returns over the following 30 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity shifts often precede volatility expansions. Current neutral regime with low vol and accumulation suggests complacency before potential bull move. October's liquidity crash reset volatility expectations, creating asymmetry.
entry_conditions: FjordHQ regime model signals NEUTRAL->BULL transition (confidence > 60%)
Spot CVD positive for 5+ consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 30-day implied volatility increases by 20 percentage points

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >70% of NEUTRAL->BULL transitions since 2023 occurred without significant volatility expansion (realized vol increase < 10pp).
